title: Rüppell's fox
summary:
Rüppell's fox (Vulpes rueppellii), also called Rüppell's sand fox, is a fox species living in desert and semi-desert regions of North Africa, the Middle East, and southwestern Asia. It has been listed as Least Concern on the IUCN Red List since 2008.[1]
It is named after the German naturalist Eduard Rüppell.[3]
